resources.string: The notation serves to name the movements of all the layers of the cube more easily
Final goal, Make a cross in which the four edges of the cross fit with the color of the side centers
Put all the white edges on the white center face
Turn the layer until at least two edges fit with the side centers color
Now you can have two cases to swap the two remaining edges
white on left \nD\' R\' D R
white on bottom \nR\' D2 R D R\' D\' R
Move the white corner under the spot where it\'s supposed to be
And repeat for all the corners
The letter means a single clockwise turn, letter followed by \' means counter-clockwise turn and letter followed by 2 means two turns
"The centers do not move, they are always in the same position, white opposite with yellow, red opposite with orange and blue opposite with green"
The red arrows indicate the two pieces that are swap and the letters indicate the movements that must be made following the notations that we have seen in the first section.
If you need to take a corner to put it somewhere else or is in place but misdirected do: R\' D\' R to get it out
Put an edge that has to go to the second layer above a center with the same color
If you need to take a edge to put it somewhere else or is in place but misdirected do: U R U\' R\' U\' F\' U F to get it out
If the edge has to go to the right \nU R U\' R\' U\' F\' U F
If the edge has to go left \nU\' L\' U L U F U\' F\'
Now you can have two cases
If you have a point do the algorithm and you will get an L
If you have an L do the algorithm and you will get a line
If you have a line do the algorithm and you will get the cross
Look only at the edges look if you have a point, an L, a line or you already have the cross \nAlgorithm: F R U R\' U\' F\'

Rotate the layer until only one edge fits with the color of a center and do R U R\' U R U2 R\' until they fit all (can be once or twice) If you can not fit just one edge do the algorithm and try again
Final goal, put all the corners of the last layer in the right place, they do not have to be well oriented

Find a corner that is in the right place, put it to the right and do U R U\' L\' U R\' U\' L until all the corners are in the correct place (do it once or twice) If there is no corner in the right place do the algorithm and look again

Now just need to orient, put one of the corners that is not oriented up-right and do R\' D\' R D (do it two or four times) until the corner is oriented, now with movements of U, U\' or U2 (DO NOT rotate the whole cube) put another corner that is not oriented and repeats it. \n\nWhile doing this step it might seems that you messed up the cube.
Do U2 R\' D\' R D twice but as the corner is not oriented repeat it twice.
Do U2 to put the other corner to the right and do R\' D\' R D twice and U2 to finish the cube
The world records may have changed, these are the ones from September 2017
Cubecomps: results of competitions in progress.
